items.title: 'Heartbreaking': The children Australia won’t bring home from a Syrian detention camp
items.summary: The women and children who recently smuggled themselves out of a Syrian detention camp and returned to Australia proved that the government could bring its citizens home if it had the will, advocates say.

items.title: It's on Australia's 'do not travel' list. But influencers are promoting it anyway
items.summary: A surge of travel vloggers is putting Afghanistan back on the tourism map, even as the Taliban tightens restrictions on women and security risks remain high.

items.title: 'Manifestly inadequate': Prosecutors to appeal Erin Patterson's sentence
items.summary: The 51-year-old was sentenced to life in prison for the murder of three relatives.

items.title: Police to charge alleged gunman after up to 50 bullets fired in 'random' Sydney shooting
items.summary: Numerous bystanders, cars and police were fired on during a two-hour window in Croydon Park on Sunday.

items.title: Israelis like Michal and Yarden act as 'human shields' in the West Bank. They've been called traitors
items.summary: As the second anniversary of October 7 and Israel’s war in Gaza approaches, settler violence in the West Bank is steadily escalating. A small number of Israelis like Yarden want to end the 'status quo' — and they're willing to act as human shields to achieve it.

items.title: The Australians who think it's fine to steal, and those who disagree
items.summary: A new survey found a generational divide when it comes to rationalising retail theft behaviours, including scanning items incorrectly at self-checkout.

items.title: 'We do not see any change': Israel pounds Gaza despite Trump's call for end to bombing
items.summary: There was no let-up in Israeli attacks on Gaza over the weekend as planes and tanks pounded areas across the enclave.

items.title: Zelenskyy criticises world 'silence' after yet another large-scale Russian attack
items.summary: Five people have died after the Russian military attacked Ukraine overnight with 53 missiles and several waves of drones.

items.title: Government summons Optus, Telstra to Canberra over triple-zero failings
items.summary: From 1 November, telcos will be required to provide real-time updates on network failures.

items.title: 'Determination and ingenuity': Australia's oldest man just turned 112
items.summary: Ken Weeks was still walking into town for shopping after he turned 100 more than a decade ago.

items.title: We now know when your HECS debt will be slashed, and by how much
items.summary: About three million Australians with a student debt will soon see their balance owed reduced.

items.title: Location-tracking apps: A harmful invasion of privacy or a great tool to keep loved ones safe?
items.summary: With consent, location-tracking can be immensely useful in some situations, experts say, but they warn that the technology is certainly not without potential harms and can lead to controlling and coercive behaviours.

items.title: Why Joel spends his evenings being stabbed in the head with skewers — for fun
items.summary: Blood, thumbtacks, fire, cactus plants and even whipper snippers. Welcome to the world of Australian deathmatch wrestling.

items.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 national guard troops to Chicago
items.summary: The state's governor said it was "absolutely outrageous and un-American to demand a governor send military troops within our own borders and against our will".

items.title: 'I passed out multiple times at work': The health problem costing Australia billions
items.summary: Endometriosis affects one in seven Australian women, yet experts warn workplaces remain years behind in providing support for those living with this "invisible" condition.

items.title: The major sticking points that could still upend the partially accepted Gaza peace deal
items.summary: One expert says a hostage-prisoner exchange between Israel and Hamas is "highly likely" to go ahead, but he and others remain wary about the prospects for other parts of a Gaza peace deal.

items.title: Netanyahu says he hopes to bring home all hostages from Gaza 'in the coming days'
items.summary: The Israeli leader vowed that Gaza will be demilitarised and Hamas disarmed, after the militant group partially accepted terms of a peace deal laid out by the White House.

items.title: A Thatcher-loving heavy metal drummer: Meet Japan's first female PM-in-waiting
items.summary: Sanae Takaichi has repeatedly referred to former UK leader Margaret Thatcher as a source of inspiration.

items.title: Mystery surrounds deaths of two hikers in Victoria's high country
items.summary: Police have appealed for help to identify two women who were found dead near Mount Bogong on Friday.

items.title: When do the 2025 NRL and NRLW grand finals start? Here's everything you need to know
items.summary: It will be a busy day of footy on Sunday with both the NRL and NRLW grand finals taking place. Here's what you need to know.

items.title: 'The 99 per cent are not your enemy': Genesis Owusu on power, politics and racism
items.summary: Genesis Owusu has battled racism, depression and industry pressures — but his third album is his most direct yet. He says it’s a blunt call for truth in an era of division.

items.title: Australian officials 'on the ground' helping Gaza flotilla activists detained in Israel
items.summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade says at least five Australians are detained in Israel, while Global Sumud Flotilla organisers say Israel has seven Australians in custody.

items.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to more than four years in prison
items.summary: In an address to the court before the US district judge imposed the sentence, Combs apologised to his victims, saying his behaviour was "disgusting, shameful and sick."

items.title: 700 Australians were recruited for a yoga study. What researchers found surprised them
items.summary: Many older Australians who practice yoga say it gives them strength and confidence, but a new study suggests one particular type of yoga could be associated with a higher risk of falls.
